title: Selena Gomez shares behind-the-scenes photos of her new video Look At Her Now
text:
She surprised her fans on Tuesday with Lose You To Love Me, single written over a year ago about her ex Justin Bieber.

Selena Gomez follow that up with an additional surprise the following day when she released the single Look At Her Now, and now she's offered up a look into the filming of her video.

The 27–year–old pop singer shared a series of revealing behind–the–scenes photos from set with her 158 million Instagram followers on Friday.

Sneak peek: Selena Gomez, 27, shared intimate behind–the–scenes photos to Instagram on Friday after releasing two singles in less than two days

Selena's darkly lit snaps show off the singer during some rare moments of downtime between takes of the dance-heavy video.

She opened up her album with a sweet photo of her cuddling her adorable dog Winnie.

Other images showed the Spring Breakers star being made up ahead of the shoot and relaxing with friends.

'Some of my favorite moments on set ❤️,' she captioned the darkly lit shots.

Downtime: The photos reflected the start–stop nature of filming. One featured Selena relaxing in her black latex jacket with her choreographer Charm La'Donna

Getting ready: While she sat still, her hair stylist Marissa Marino and her makeup artist Melissa Murdick helped create her impeccable look

Anyone who has ever visited a film set knows there's plenty of waiting around between takes and setups, and Selena's photos don't hide that fact.

One image revealed her chilling in her director's chair while dressed in her shining black latex jacket and pants that she used to great effect in Look At Her Now.

She was accompanied by her choreographer Charm La'Donna, who devised the athletic dance moves performed by Selena and her backup dancers on Look At Her Now.

Other photos were clearly taken from her shoot for Lose You To Love Me, the first of the two videos to be released, suggesting she filmed them back–to–back.

Peaceful: Another shot featured the same outfit and curls as she was hugged from behind while flashing a sleepy-eyed smile

Selena flashed a carefree smile while seated in the same confessional booth where most of the minimalist black and white video takes place.

Her brunette locks were styled in delicate curls cascading over her shoulders and she was dressed in the simple black tank top and black jacket worn in the video.

While she sat still, her hair stylist Marissa Marino and her makeup artist Melissa Murdick helped create her impeccable look.

Another shot featured the same outfit and curls as she was hugged from behind while flashing a sleepy-eyed smile.

Winning: A final behind–the–scenes image featured the Good For You singer flashing triumphant twin Vs from her dressing room on set

A final behind–the–scenes image featured the Good For You singer flashing triumphant twin Vs from her dressing room on set.

Selena eschewed her jacket but was dressed in the same black dress used in her first video.

In addition to signaling the arrival of an upcoming album, Selena's new videos also advertised the newest iPhone model.

The singer revealed that both her intimate Lose You To Love Me and the more ambitious Look At Her Now were filmed on the smart phone.

Coming soon: Selena's singles will likely be featured on her forthcoming album, though she advertised that both were filmed on an iPhone

In costume: The singer on set in her lustrous black jacket and with her blonde braided ponytail

The arrival of Selena's first video Lose You To Love Me briefly seemed to spark conflict between her and Justin Beiber and his wife Hailey.

The model posted a screenshot of Summer Walker and Jhené Aiko's I'll Kill You shortly after the release of Selena's song, which some fans interpreted as a thinly veiled response.

But Hailey denied that was her intent, and Selena later defended her from online trolls.

Hailey quashed talk of a new conflict between the two when she later liked a photo from Racquelle Stevens that prominently featured Selena and celebrated her new music.

Awkward: The arrival of Selena's first video Lose You To Love Me briefly seemed to spark conflict with Justin and Hailey Bieber after she confirmed the song was about her ex

Strong words: Hailey posted a screenshot of Summer Walker and Jhené Aiko's I'll Kill You shortly after the release of Selena's song, which some fans interpreted as a thinly veiled response; Justin and Hailey at their second wedding in South Carolina this year
description: Selena Gomez courted controversy with her Justin Bieber-inspired single Lose You To Love Me. After releasing a second single, she posted behind-the-scenes shots from her videos to Instagram.
